greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number array whose rows are the series reversions of x(1-x)/(1+x)^k, read by antidiagonals.
comment: First row is the Catalan numbers A000108, second row is the large Schroeder numbers A006318, third row is A062992, fourth row is A007297. As a number triangle, this is T(n,k)=if(k<=n,sum{j=0..k, binomial((n-k)(k+1),k-j)*binomial(k+j,j)}/(k+1),0) with row sums A107112 and diagonal sums A107113.
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Sum[Binomial[n (k + 1), k - j] Binomial[k + j, j], {j, 0, k}]/(k + 1);
Table[T[n - k, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 21 2020 *)
results.author: _Paul Barry_, May 12 2005
